title: Fragment (Near East), 20th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: Lampas, foundation weave in broken twill and pattern in plain weave
provenance: purchased as 11th century, Persia, Buyid, but now considered a fake or reproduction
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 46 x 38 cm (18 1/8 x 14 15/16 in.)
description: Vertical rows of connecting ovals (ogives) framing winged, four-footed monsters.  The spaces between are alternating vertical rows containing confronting peacocks with upswept tails and an area of symmetrical vines. (see provenance field)

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment (Near East), 20th century. Medium: silk
Technique: Lampas, foundation weave in broken twill and pattern in plain weave. 
1961-96-1
